content: 1 Paul､ a servant of God—an apostle moreover of Jesus Christ,— According to the faith of the chosen ones of God､ And the personal knowledge of the truth that is according to godliness,—
content_old: 1 Paul､ a servant of God—an apostle moreover of Jesus Christ,— According to the faith of the chosen ones of God､ And the personal knowledge of the truth that is according to godliness,—

content: 2 In hope of life age-abiding; Which God､ who cannot lie､ Promised before age-during times,
content_old: 2 In hope of life age-abiding; Which God､ who cannot lie､ Promised before age-during times,

content: 3 But hath manifested in its fitting seasons, Even his word､ in the proclamation with which entrusted am I— By injunction of our Saviour God:
content_old: 3 But hath manifested in its fitting seasons, Even his word､ in the proclamation with which entrusted am I— By injunction of our Saviour God:

content: 4 Unto Titus､ my true child according to a common faith,— Favour and peace､ From God our Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
content_old: 4 Unto Titus､ my true child according to a common faith,— Favour and peace､ From God our Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.

content: 5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, That the things remaining undone thou mightest completely set in order, And mightest establish in every city elders､ As I with thee arranged:—
content_old: 5 For this cause left I thee in Crete, That the things remaining undone thou mightest completely set in order, And mightest establish in every city elders､ As I with thee arranged:—

content: 6 If anyone is unaccusable､ a husband of one wife､ having children that believe､ who are not charged with riotous excess､ nor insubordinate;
content_old: 6 If anyone is unaccusable､ a husband of one wife､ having children that believe､ who are not charged with riotous excess､ nor insubordinate;

content: 7 For it is needful that the overseer be— Unaccusable as God’s steward､ not self-willed､ not soon angry､ not given to wine､ not ready to wound､ not seeking gain by base means,
content_old: 7 For it is needful that the overseer be— Unaccusable as God’s steward､ not self-willed､ not soon angry､ not given to wine､ not ready to wound､ not seeking gain by base means,

content: 8 But hospitable､ a lover of what is good､ sober-minded､ just､ kind､ possessing self-control,
content_old: 8 But hospitable､ a lover of what is good､ sober-minded､ just､ kind､ possessing self-control,

content: 9 Holding fast in the matter of his teaching the faithful word, That he may be able both to encourage with his healthful instruction､ and the gainsayers to refute.
content_old: 9 Holding fast in the matter of his teaching the faithful word, That he may be able both to encourage with his healthful instruction､ and the gainsayers to refute.

content: 10 For there are many unruly men､ Vain talkers and deceivers, Especially they of the circumcision,—
content_old: 10 For there are many unruly men､ Vain talkers and deceivers, Especially they of the circumcision,—

content: 11 Whose mouths must needs be stopped, Men who are upsetting whole houses､ Teaching the things which ought not to be taught— For the sake of base gain.
content_old: 11 Whose mouths must needs be stopped, Men who are upsetting whole houses､ Teaching the things which ought not to be taught— For the sake of base gain.

content: 12 Said one from among them､ a prophet of their own— Cretans! always false､ mischievous wild-beasts､ idle gluttons:
content_old: 12 Said one from among them､ a prophet of their own— Cretans! always false､ mischievous wild-beasts､ idle gluttons:

content: 13 This witness is true,— For which cause be reproving them sharply, That they may be healthy in their faith,
content_old: 13 This witness is true,— For which cause be reproving them sharply, That they may be healthy in their faith,

content: 14 Not giving heed to Judaical stories and commandments of men who are turning away from the truth:
content_old: 14 Not giving heed to Judaical stories and commandments of men who are turning away from the truth:

content: 15 All things are pure unto the pure, But unto the polluted and faithless Nothing is pure､ But polluted are both their mind and conscience;
content_old: 15 All things are pure unto the pure, But unto the polluted and faithless Nothing is pure､ But polluted are both their mind and conscience;

content: 1 But do thou speak the things which become the healthful instruction:—
content_old: 1 But do thou speak the things which become the healthful instruction:—

content: 2 That aged men be sober､ grave､ sober-minded, healthy in their faith､ love､ endurance;
content_old: 2 That aged men be sober､ grave､ sober-minded, healthy in their faith､ love､ endurance;

content: 3 Aged women､ in the same way in deportment as becometh sacred persons, not given to intrigue､ nor yet to much wine enslaved, teachers of virtue,—
content_old: 3 Aged women､ in the same way in deportment as becometh sacred persons, not given to intrigue､ nor yet to much wine enslaved, teachers of virtue,—

content: 4 That they may constrain the young women to be lovers of their husbands､ lovers of their children､
content_old: 4 That they may constrain the young women to be lovers of their husbands､ lovers of their children､

content: 5 soberminded､ chaste workers at home､ good, Submitting themselves to their own husbands,—That the word of God be not defamed;
content_old: 5 soberminded､ chaste workers at home､ good, Submitting themselves to their own husbands,—That the word of God be not defamed;

content: 6 The younger men､ in the same way exhort thou to be sober-minded:
content_old: 6 The younger men､ in the same way exhort thou to be sober-minded:

content: 7 In all things shewing thyself an ensample of noble works,—
content_old: 7 In all things shewing thyself an ensample of noble works,—

content: 8 In thine instruction uncorruptness､ gravity､ healthful discourse that cannot be condemned, In order that he that is of the contrary part may relent､ Having nothing to say concerning us that is disparaging:
content_old: 8 In thine instruction uncorruptness､ gravity､ healthful discourse that cannot be condemned, In order that he that is of the contrary part may relent､ Having nothing to say concerning us that is disparaging:

content: 9 Servants､ unto their own masters to be submitting themselves in all things, to be well-pleasing, not gainsaying､
content_old: 9 Servants､ unto their own masters to be submitting themselves in all things, to be well-pleasing, not gainsaying､

content: 10 not taking anything away､ shewing all good faith,— That the instruction which is of our Saviour God they may adorn in all things.
content_old: 10 not taking anything away､ shewing all good faith,— That the instruction which is of our Saviour God they may adorn in all things.

content: 11 For the favour of God､ bringing salvation for all men､ hath shone forth,
content_old: 11 For the favour of God､ bringing salvation for all men､ hath shone forth,

content: 12 Putting us under discipline— In order that､— Denying ourselves of ungodliness and worldly covetings In a soberminded and righteous and godly manner we should live､ in the present age,
content_old: 12 Putting us under discipline— In order that､— Denying ourselves of ungodliness and worldly covetings In a soberminded and righteous and godly manner we should live､ in the present age,

content: 13 Prepared to welcome the happy hope and forthshining of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Christ Jesus,—
content_old: 13 Prepared to welcome the happy hope and forthshining of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Christ Jesus,—

content: 14 Who gave himself up in our behalf, That he might redeem us from all manner of lawlessness､ And purify for himself a people as his own treasure—Zealous of noble works.
content_old: 14 Who gave himself up in our behalf, That he might redeem us from all manner of lawlessness､ And purify for himself a people as his own treasure—Zealous of noble works.

content: 1 Be putting them in mind unto rulerships､ unto authorities to be in submission, to be yielding to rule, For every good work to be prepared,
content_old: 1 Be putting them in mind unto rulerships､ unto authorities to be in submission, to be yielding to rule, For every good work to be prepared,

content: 2 To be defaming no one, to be averse to strife, considerate, shewing all meekness unto all men.
content_old: 2 To be defaming no one, to be averse to strife, considerate, shewing all meekness unto all men.

content: 3 For even we used､ at one time､ to be—Thoughtless､ unyielding､ deceived, In servitude unto manifold covetings and pleasures, In malice and envy leading on, Detestable, Hating one another.
content_old: 3 For even we used､ at one time､ to be—Thoughtless､ unyielding､ deceived, In servitude unto manifold covetings and pleasures, In malice and envy leading on, Detestable, Hating one another.

content: 4 But when the graciousness and affection for man of our Saviour God shone forth
content_old: 4 But when the graciousness and affection for man of our Saviour God shone forth

content: 5 Not by works which we had done in righteousness, But according to his mercy he saved us— Through means of the bathing of a new birth､ And the moulding anew of Holy Spirit,—
content_old: 5 Not by works which we had done in righteousness, But according to his mercy he saved us— Through means of the bathing of a new birth､ And the moulding anew of Holy Spirit,—

content: 6 Which he poured on us richly､ through Jesus Christ our Saviour,
content_old: 6 Which he poured on us richly､ through Jesus Christ our Saviour,

content: 7 In order that having been declared righteous by his favour we should be made inheritors､ according to hope､ of life age-abiding.
content_old: 7 In order that having been declared righteous by his favour we should be made inheritors､ according to hope､ of life age-abiding.

content: 8 Faithful the saying! and concerning these things I am minded that thou be strongly affirming, In order that they who have believed God may be careful to be forward in noble works. These things are honourable､ and profitable unto men;
content_old: 8 Faithful the saying! and concerning these things I am minded that thou be strongly affirming, In order that they who have believed God may be careful to be forward in noble works. These things are honourable､ and profitable unto men;

content: 9 But foolish questionings､ and genealogies､ and strife､ and contentions about matters of law avoid, For they are unprofitable and vain.
content_old: 9 But foolish questionings､ and genealogies､ and strife､ and contentions about matters of law avoid, For they are unprofitable and vain.

content: 10 From a party-man､ after a first and second admonition excuse thyself;
content_old: 10 From a party-man､ after a first and second admonition excuse thyself;

content: 11 Knowing that such a one is perverted､ and sinneth, being self-condemned.
content_old: 11 Knowing that such a one is perverted､ and sinneth, being self-condemned.

content: 12 As soon as I shall send Artemus unto thee, or Tychicus give diligence to come to me unto Nicopolis; For there have I determined to winter.
content_old: 12 As soon as I shall send Artemus unto thee, or Tychicus give diligence to come to me unto Nicopolis; For there have I determined to winter.

content: 13 Zenas the lawyer､ and Apollos do thou diligently set forward on their way, In order that nothing､ unto them may be wanting.
content_old: 13 Zenas the lawyer､ and Apollos do thou diligently set forward on their way, In order that nothing､ unto them may be wanting.

content: 14 Moreover､ let our own learn to be forward in honourable works for the necessary uses, That they may not be unfruitful.
content_old: 14 Moreover､ let our own learn to be forward in honourable works for the necessary uses, That they may not be unfruitful.
